meanings.definition: To criticize someone by making malicious and false statements about them.
meanings.sent1: She likes to mudsling her classmates when they disagree with her.
meanings.sent2: It is not right to mudsling others just because you are upset.
meanings.sent3: The gossip at school turned into a mudslinging contest among friends.
meanings.sent4: His opponents tried to mudsling him during the election campaign.
meanings.sent5: The tabloids often mudsling celebrities to sell more copies.

meanings.definition: The act of engaging in malicious and false criticism of someone.
meanings.sent1: The mudsling at the debate was unnecessary and hurtful.
meanings.sent2: She was hurt by the mudsling directed at her character.
meanings.sent3: The mudsling in the office was causing tension among coworkers.
meanings.sent4: The political campaign was filled with mudsling from both sides.
meanings.sent5: The online forum was full of mudsling about the new policy.
